objects.description: [AndroidOS/MalLocker.B](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0524) can prevent the user from interacting with the UI by using a carefully crafted "call" notification screen. This is coupled with overriding the `onUserLeaveHint()` callback method to spawn a new notification instance when the current one is dismissed. (Citation: Microsoft MalLockerB)

external_references.description: D. Venkatesan. (2020, October 8). Sophisticated new Android malware marks the latest evolution of mobile ransomware . Retrieved October 29, 2020.
